I've recently been trying to find rap to listen to. I discovered Tupac and really like him, particularly "Keep Ya Head Up" and "Brenda's Got a Baby." I like Nas' "I Can" and Kanye West's "Jesus Walks" but haven't heard anything else by them. Basically, I'm looking for other good rap that people can recommend to me. I don't care as much about the production side of things, I care more about the lyric and sound of the rapper himself. I suppose that's reflected in the Tupac stuff that I like and in the fact that I like freestyle and some early rap that I've heard. So, any recommendations? Let me know songs and artists so I know where to specifically look.

Start at the beginning would be my advice. Run DMC, NWA, Easy E.
 
 I like Nellie's stuff for something contemporary.

My favorite rap is "Amish Paradise," "Couch Potato," "All About The Pentiums," and "Trash Day."...

 I don't think rap music takes a "high degree of musical talent." The drum beats are not very complex, the "instrumentals" are usually computer generated and aren't even made by real instruments, and the tempo is moderate compared to other forms of music like, for example, punk rock. I think any form of music where real instruments are involved takes way more talent than any type of rap music. In fact, a lot of rappers use other people's music as samples in their own songs. Frequently, the only original track in the song is the drum beat and maybe a bass line or weird noise here and there. Musically, rap songs are just as repetitive as any other type of music, sometimes even more so by using loops. In most rap songs, the talent comes into play with the lyrics and the speed in which the lyrics are delivered. Perhaps this is what you meant by "tempo" in your post above, but that would be incorrect. You can have a rapper deliver blazing fast lyrics over a song with a slow tempo. Clearly, I don't think gangster rap songs contain much talent lyrically. However, there are a lot of underground hip-hop groups that have fantastic, mind-provoking lyrics in their songs that are relevant to society and life. I think it is important to make this distinction. The music in rap songs to me is boring, repetitive and, quite frankly, I could make up most of the beats I hear in my sleep. But if you have ever heard a good freestyle battle, that is where you will see the true talent.

Having to input every individual note doesn't make it any easier, but how else would it be done? I spent 5 hours to write a 2 1/2 minute song, but it was worth it.

 I don't have a keyboard at home, but at school we had a couple programs where you could play each instrument and then edit them after they'd been played. That was nice because I'd just hit record and start playing around. If I found something I liked I could manipulate it, move it around, add to it, etc. Unfortunately the software as well as the keyboard aren't exactly cheap, so I'll have to stick with the real piano with composing when I'm at home.

lol i sequence midis.

 What is that?
What kind of stuff have you written on the piano zachvac

What is that?

 a midi sequencer is a simple program that lets you express a piece of music graphically. your layout is a large grid, with the rows being musical notes, and the columns being the timeline. as you place musical notes along the grid, you set where in the timelime each note will play, the duration of the note, as well as a lot of other things like pitc, velocity, volume, etc, or individual notes, if you want to get complicated. in a midi sequencer you can also add more instruments and drum tracks, each with its own "channel", each expressed on its own grid, and make very rich and complex songs this way. in fact, you can make musical compositions that would actually be impossible for one person to play, no matter how dexterous he/she was

My keyboard is a Korg Poly-800II. It was made in the mid 1980s. As far as keyboards goes that is kind of old. Not ancient by any means and it still is a good keyboard. It started breaking though. 3 keys don't make any sounds and an E flat key in the middle of the board is sticking up way to high. I can't use it very well until I fix it or get someone else who can fix it cheap.
